summary:
Pompeii was an ancient Roman city near Naples, Italy. In 79 AD, Mount Vesuvius erupted, burying the city in volcanic ash. This disaster preserved Pompeii, giving us a rare glimpse into Roman life. The city had beautiful buildings, rich decorations, and even preserved bodies, providing valuable archaeological information.

Rediscovered in the 16th century, excavations revealed well-preserved homes, public buildings, and art. These findings offer insights into ancient architecture, daily life, and even the language of the time. Today, Pompeii is a popular tourist site and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, attracting millions due to its unique historical value.
title: Pompeii
